result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad Allen Payne appeared by phone.  Attorney Francis P Raff appeared by video for Chad Allen Payne. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court Appointed Attorney Payment Information

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad Allen Payne in court. Court finds the Defendant indigent and appoints attorney Frank Raff. Defendant to reimburse the County $70 per month.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Indigency hearing on July 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.
